summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and attorney Jack Goldberger regarding contact procedures for victims' attorneys in the Epstein case. The AUSA is seeking confirmation that Goldberger is the designated contact for victim claims.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Identified as the contact person for attorneys representing victims who wish to file claims in the Epstein case. Provides his office address as sufficient contact information.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Corresponds with Jack Goldberger to confirm he is the designated contact for victim attorneys and to obtain contact information to provide to them.

connections.description: The AUSA is communicating with Goldberger to establish official contact protocols for victim attorneys in the Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination for Victim Claims Contact
events.description: Email exchange finalizing that Jack Goldberger is the designated contact person for attorneys representing victims who may file claims, with his office address provided as the contact point.

keyFacts: Jack Goldberger is confirmed as the official contact person for attorneys representing victims who wish to file claims related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The communication indicates an ongoing legal process where victim claims are being anticipated and a contact protocol is being established by the U.S. Attorney's office.
The correspondence is dated July 2008, placing it during the period of the initial federal investigation into Epstein in Florida.
